chunks.text: So is consent only verbal? No, it's not. There's a whole lot of, I guess, cues that need to be taken.
Consent can be verbal, but there's also a lot of other body language that would indicate whether consent is given or not.
Example of that could be that if someone is pressured constantly for sex, in the end they turn around and go, oh, okay then.
Is that really consent? In my around and go, oh okay then.
In my view, no it's not.
A good way of looking at it I believe is called enthusiastic consent.
If consent is not enthusiastically given, then you shouldn't be partaking in any sexual activity.

Is that really consent? In my view, no it's not. A good way of looking at it I believe is called enthusiastic consent.
